page.title: 14SUTTON VILLAGE
page.content: Sutton is a residential village. Much of the housing is built along the old Yarmouth Road. There are two small estates of bungalows, a council house estate and an estate of semi-detached houses. Many of the older houses are on Church Road. One of the oldest buildings in the village is Durrant's Farmhouse which was built around 1660. The village has a Post Office, a general store and a garden centre. Mr Flatman has a pottery on Church Road. On the corner of Staithe Road is the village pond. It was cleared this year and new vegetation is appearing. Moorhens and ducks have nested in the reeds this year. Drainage on the pond corner is poor as this road is very low lying. It often floods in heavy rain.
